job_description:
The Nippon Express Group is a global logistics service provider whose Japanese corporation is headquartered in Tokyo, Japan. Our services range from air and ocean freight forwarding to cargo, removal services and warehouse operations. The company has numerous freight centers, warehouses and provides logistics services in over 45 countries on six continents with a global network of over 70,000 employees. The logistics focus is mainly on automotive and fashion industries, pharmaceutical products and further consumer goods. Since our founding in 1937, the Nippon Express Group has always used its logistics strengths as a social responsibility to connect people and regions.
Nippon Express Europe is enhancing its digitalisation strategy by expanding its cloud analytics platform based on Tableau. The platform supports data integration and enables data driven decision making across organisations, divisions, products, customers and industries within the region.
On these grounds, we are looking for a Business Analyst - EMEA (m/f/d) in Amsterdam. You will be part of the Tableau Team within the General Affairs & Finance Division.
These are your responsibilities:
As business analyst you will take ownership on project level for various stakeholders to meet data and analytics requirements by creating dashboards/reports/visualisations on Tableau cloud platform. In addition, you will cooperate with other Tableau key users from our European Head Quarter or its subsidiaries to develop analytics and reporting capabilities on the platform.

In addition:
Managing the various interest of your stakeholders (Business, IT, Customer etc.)
Understanding business requirements and translate them to solutions on Tableau cloud
Working in cross-functional and cross-domain setting
Creating dashboards, data visualisation & data stories
Processing improvements to enable analytics
Cleansing data
Supporting implementation of Tableau

This is what we are looking for:
Excellent communication skills
Professional appearance, ability to work in a team
Ability to manage in a matrix organization
Experience with Tableau or Power BI
Project management experience is preferred
Analytical skills with focus on details
Data literacy to expand platform adoption
Experience with data quality framework
Creative and problem solving mindset
Self-motivated with the ability to work independently
Hands-on mentality

This is what you can look forward to:
A permanent position
An attractive salary
An international environment in a leading logistics company
A challenging and varied range of tasks
The possibility of working remote

Your Application
If we sparked your interest, we are looking forward to your application. You can submit your application by filling in the form on the right hand side of this page. For more information you can always contact our recruiter Kees-Jan Band via +31 88 5678 399

job_description:
Jezelf de waaromvraag blijven stellen voor het beste resultaat voor onze klanten. Daar geloven wij bij Identify in. Daarom ben jij als business analist/proces analist altijd nieuwsgierig en alert. Hierdoor lukt het jou om belangrijke processen bij klanten te analyseren én te optimaliseren.

Als business analist/proces analist breng jij in kaart hoe de processen bij opdrachtgevers verlopen en wat de eisen zijn voor hun (nieuw) te bouwen applicatie. Je gaat op jacht naar de requirements en processen. Hiervoor stel jij de juiste vragen aan de juiste stakeholders. Je werkt hierbij alleen of in een groep van analisten. Uiteindelijk presenteer jij de resultaten met een sterke onderbouwing en streef je er altijd naar de verwachting van de klant te overtreffen.

Op een typische dag van een business analist start je op met een kop koffie en stem je de user stories die op de backlog staan af met de product owner. Vervolgens start de dag pas écht met een daily standup met het hele team. Daarna ga je in gesprek met de gebruikers van het nieuwe systeem of de nieuwe functionaliteit waar jij de requirements voor opstelt. Tijdens de lunch maak je een wandeling met de projectleider om ook informeel bij te praten. Na de lunch werk je het gesprek met de gebruikers uit in user stories en acceptatiecriteria. De afhankelijkheden met andere teams en systemen breng je in kaart en je overlegt dit met de product owner en business manager. Aan het einde van de dag heb jij alle wensen van de stakeholders goed in je requirements beschreven en op elkaar afgestemd. Je rijdt met een goed gevoel naar huis omdat je weet dat je straks voor de klant iets oplevert waar deze meer dan tevreden over gaat zijn.

Je komt bij Identify terecht in een divers, kleinschalig team. Ook al werk je bij klanten op locatie, je houdt goed contact met je enthousiaste mede-Identifiers. Zo organiseren we regelmatig een teamweekend, familiedag of kennissessie. Daarnaast is Identify een platte organisatie, waardoor de lijntjes kort zijn en we geen ivoren torens kennen.

Wij vragen van jou:
Minimaal drie jaar werkervaring als business analist/proces analist. Aantoonbare ervaring en/of affiniteit met de IT-wereld is een must.
Daarnaast heb je een wo- of hbo-opleiding afgerond. Welke richting is niet belangrijk. We zien namelijk de meerwaarde van zoveel mogelijk verschillende achtergronden en dus een zo divers mogelijke kijk op zaken binnen ons team.
Door jouw werkervaring weet je alles van agile, scrum en DevOps. Ook heb je kennis van (business) analyse methoden en modelleringstechnieken, zoals IREB, BPM, BPMN en UML. Bij voorkeur ben je hierin gecertificeerd.
Je hebt ervaring in het opstellen van meetbare acceptatiecriteria en je weet hoe je epics vertaalt in features en user stories. Hierdoor heb je ook ervaring met requirements tools zoals Jira, Confluence en Enterprise Architect.
Met jouw sterke communicatieve vaardigheden kun jij stakeholders goed uitvragen over hun wensen en deze vertalen in concrete, resultaatgerichte requirements.
Je weet je doelen te bereiken met de beschikbare middelen en tijd. Ook ben je in staat om deze te behalen onder druk of onvoorziene omstandigheden.
Je hebt ervaring met het faciliteren en leiden van workshops en brainstormsessies.
Je wilt jezelf blijven ontwikkelen en je deelt nieuwe kennis met je collega’s.
Je hebt oog voor nieuwe kansen voor Identify. Hierbij neem jij het initiatief om deze kansen te benutten.
Je bent bereid om bij de klant op locatie te werken en, ook al doen we ons best om de reistijd zo kort mogelijk te houden, je hebt geen bezwaar tegen een uur reistijd enkele reis.
Je bent een bevlogen teamspeler en herkent je in onze kernwaarden: integriteit, plezier, vrijheid, betrokkenheid en kwaliteit/servicegerichtheid.
Wij bieden jou:
Een verantwoordelijke en uitdagende functie bij een organisatie waar oprechte aandacht is voor jou als persoon en waar wordt geïnvesteerd in zowel je professionele als je persoonlijke ontwikkeling.
Interessante opdrachten bij aansprekende klanten door het hele land. Parkmobile, Schiphol en Attero zijn enkele voorbeelden uit ons klantenportfolio.
Een contract van 32 tot 40 uur voor onbepaalde tijd. Hierbij ontvang je een goed salaris dat past bij jouw kennis en ervaring.
27 vakantiedagen per jaar, met de mogelijkheid om vakantiedagen bij te kopen.
Bovenop je salaris een leaseauto óf mobiliteitsbudget, 8,33% vakantietoeslag, een laptop en een maandelijkse onkostenvergoeding.
Een jaarlijks opleidingsbudget van €3.000,-, tenzij je ons kunt overtuigen dat je meer nodig hebt. We zien namelijk graag dat je jezelf blijft ontwikkelen met een opleiding die aansluit bij jouw ambities.
Tijd om events, congressen en webinars bij te wonen waarmee je jouw kennis over je vakgebied kunt vergroten.
Alle ruimte om mee te denken en mee te werken aan de verdere ontwikkeling van Identify.
De mogelijkheid om aan te sluiten bij een team van enthousiaste professionals dat je tijdens teamweekenden, familiedagen en kennissessies nog beter leert kennen.
Over Identify

Identify is een consultancybureau dat opereert op het snijvlak van business en IT. Al sinds 2010 zorgen wij voor optimalisatie van product- en proceskwaliteit in opdrachten bij onze klanten. We richten ons op kwaliteits- en ketenregie, softwaretesten, agile werken en procesoptimalisatie. Daarnaast zijn wij Atlassian Silver Partner.

Wij zijn op zoek naar een ervaren Business Analist die kan bijdragen aan het verbeteren van onze organisatieprocessen. Je signaleert en herkent de wensen en behoeften van de business en vertaalt deze naar bruikbare en efficiënte oplossingen. Dit doe je door een projectvoorstellen te formuleren waarin je rekening houdt met onze organisatiestructuur en bedrijfsprocessen. Je werkt nauw samen met verschillende afdelingen in Nederland en Zweden. Zoals met IT, Producten, Systeembeheer, Financial Crime Prevention, Compliance en Legal.Wat ga je doen als Business Analist:Verzamelen, documenteren en beheren van de wensen en de behoefte van de business.Optreden als business architect en een eerste aanspreekpunt zijn met betrekking tot IT architectuur en business development.Opstellen van een projectplan met een oplossingsrichting, benodigde middelen, planning, risico’s, budget en projectdoelstellingen.In samenspraak met alle interne en externe betrokkenen het coördineren van de uitvoering van het projectplan en het informeren van alle stakeholders bij de besluitvorming.Waarborgen van de kwaliteit van de uitvoering van het projectplan.Dit bieden wij jou:Een salaris van minimaal €3.440 en maximaal €6.695 bruto per maand, op basis van een 40-urige werkweek. Het uiteindelijke salaris is afhankelijk van je kennis en ervaring.Een 13e maand en 8% vakantiegeld. Je kan er voor kiezen om dit per maand uit te laten betalen.Een winstdelingsregeling,Jaarlijks 30 vakantiedagen (bij 40 uur) én de mogelijkheid om vakantiedagen bij te kopen of te verkopen.Een premievrije pensioenregeling.Reiskostenvergoeding en/of een leasefietsregeling.De mogelijkheid om jouw eigen carrière pad te kiezen.Deel nemen aan projecten die jou interesseren.Een leuke werksfeer. Lees hier hoe het is om bij Handelsbanken te werken.Onbeperkt leermogelijkheden zowel op persoonlijk als professioneel vlak.Veel aandacht voor jouw welzijn en een goede balans tussen je werk- en privéleven.Speciaal voor medewerkers heeft Handelsbanken een eigen eiland met vakantiehuisjes in de Stockholm Archipel.Hypotheekrentekorting (onder bepaalde voorwaarden).Een abonnement op het Financieel Dagblad.Een premievrije arbeidsongeschiktheidsverzekering.Wat breng je mee:Je bent in staat om wensen van de business te vertalen naar eenduidige requirements.Je bent resultaatgericht en je neemt je verantwoordelijkheid.Je hebt sterke analytische vaardigheden en bent in staat om complexe informatie te structureren.Je bent in staat om actief mee te bepalen over (IT) oplossingen, met inachtneming van de strategie van de bank.Je staat open voor innovatie en nieuwe werkwijzen zoals Agile werken.Je beschikt over projectmanagement vaardigheden en bent in staat om een projectplan op te stellen en uit te voeren.Je hebt kennis van of affiniteit met IT infrastructuur.Je hebt meerdere jaren ervaring met stakeholdermanagement.Je vindt het leuk om:De business en stakeholders interviewen en ontdekken en toetsen wat de daadwerkelijke behoefte is.Een projectvoorstel schrijven op basis waarvan het management beslissing kan nemen over de prioriteitstelling en de uitvoering.Werken bij een internationale bank in de Nederlandse markt waar naast commercie, wet- en regelgeving een grote rol speelt.Je bent in staat om je duidelijk uit te drukken naar collega's en de klanten zowel mondeling als schriftelijk in het Nederlands en in het Engels.Over Handelsbanken en Optimix:Met onze Zweedse wortels en decentrale organisatie zijn wij een unieke bank in de Nederlandse bancaire sector. Wij zijn een persoonlijke relatiebank voor particulieren, vastgoedondernemers en vastgoedbedrijven. Sinds 1 september 2016, maakt ook Optimix Vermogensbeheer, met een team van 40 specialisten verdeeld over drie kantoren, zelfstandig onderdeel uit van Handelsbanken Nederland.Bij Handelsbanken hechten we grote waarde aan een prettige werksfeer waarin iedereen zichzelf kan zijn. We staan ervoor open om van elkaar te leren en elkaar te helpen. Je staat er niet alleen voor, we bouwen samen aan de toekomst van onze bank. We zijn op ons best als we samenwerken in teams waar verschillende perspectieven elkaar vinden, waarin iedereen zich gehoord en gerespecteerd voelt en de kans krijgt om impact te maken. Jouw kennis, ervaring en achtergrond maakt jou uniek. En samen komen we tot de beste ideeën. Bij Handelsbanken geloven we dat iedereen bijdraagt aan en verantwoordelijkheid heeft voor het creëren van een cultuur waarin iedereen kan floreren. Lees hier meer over inclusie en diversiteit binnen Handelsbanken.Solliciteer nuWil jij bij Handelsbanken werken, impact maken en waarde toevoegen aan onze organisatie? Solliciteer dan direct op deze vacature! Lees hier hoe het sollicitatieproces verder verloopt. Als je ons beter wil leren kennen, bekijk testimoniums van collega’s.Is dit niet helemaal de geschikte vacature voor jou? Wij denken graag met je mee over een passende functie bij Handelsbanken, stuur een open sollicitatie.*Please note: To be eligible for this position you must be in possession of a valid working visa / permit to work in the Netherlands.*Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld.Soort dienstverband: FulltimeSalaris: €3.440,00 - €6.695,00 per maand

job_description:
Business Analyst
At a glance

We are New10, a financial service scale-up initiated by ABN AMRO. At New10 we believe that business financing should be easy and accessible. Our purpose is to empower businesses to access funding on their terms.
Though our mission is simple, our ambition is bold: become the #1 engine powering North-West European SMEs. We are on a quest to transform the financing ecosystem by leveraging the speed and innovative strength of a fintech with the expertise and funding of a bank to deliver a fast, simple and clear financing experience to SME businesses. To support our growth towards this ambition, we’re looking for a business analyst.
Your job

As a business analyst at New10, you will be closely working with Product & Technology in a dedicated business domain. You will be responsible for analysis, preparing stories and solution design.
Get clarity of the requirement of the business and external clients and translate in user stories
Support the domain in solution architect to optimize the product
Performs (product) analysis: deep dive on how our product is being used, collect, and synthesize quantitative data to support decisions
To support Continuous Improvement, combine the findings with CX insights and findings in existing processes/journeys in a structured manner and present scenarios to Product Owner of the Business Domain.
Are you the link between the business and technology? Are you able to translate business rules and regulatory requirements into digital solutions that support entrepreneur’s growth? You love complexity and with your strong communication skills, you help us navigate to understand the full picture. Your analytical mindset and problem-solving skills help you in defining solutions together with our tech teams and UX specialists.
Working environment

At New10 we put our people first. We offer an open, collaborative, and supportive working environment and guarantee every New10er that they’ll have a tremendous opportunity for long-term growth and learning. Between the 130 of us, from 30+ different nationalities, we are:
Entrepreneurs ourselves, thinking on our feet and making sure the right things happen
Genuinely interested and curious, seeking to deeply understand our customers and their context
Driven by data, embracing creativity and exciting technologies
Open-minded, bringing fresh perspectives and jumping at the opportunity to build a great team together
Your profile

We’re looking for someone who has…
Experience with agile way of working, preferably as business analyst in a financial organization
Analytical mindset that doesn’t get lost in detail
Great command of the English language
Strong verbal and written communication skills, and easily get on with people from different backgrounds.
Experience with stakeholder management.
Understanding of the technology is preferable
We are offering
The unique opportunity to grow with a fast-growing fintech scale-up/ working with the newest technology
Hybrid way of working, balanced with office life and in-person events at our fantastic offices near Amstel Station with nerf guns, hoverboards and table football & events like summer parties, wine tastings, hackathons, winter sports and much more
The possibility of working from abroad plus access to all Spaces offices worldwide.
Apple Gear
Interested?

Please submit your CV and Cover Letter via the Application button. If your profile looks like a match we'll invite you for our initial conversation with one of our teams.
Here's what you can expect about the hiring process:Step 1: 15 min introduction call with hiring managerStep 2: 2 interviews with New10 colleagues focusing on 1. Experience and 2. CultureStep 3: Case and presentationStep 4: Final job offerStep 5: Awesome onboarding
For more information you can give us a call Astrid Joosten 06-57877341 or Sebastian Sawicki 06-12422396
Equal opportunities for all

The success of our organisation depends on the quality of our people and the ideas that they have. Truly surprising insights and innovative solutions for our clients result from an interplay of cultures, knowledge and experience. Diversity is therefore extremely important to our organisation. To ensure that everyone at ABN AMRO can develop their talents, we encourage an inclusive culture in which all colleagues feel engaged and appreciated.
Disclaimer external recruitment agencies

job_description:
For one of our biggest client in the financial industry, we are looking for our next Business analyst who has affinity with mobile applications and payments environment. The candidate will work with a customer onboarding team to improve the customer journey and add new journeys.

The ideal candidate should have:

a reliability perspective and challenge others to make the best technical decisions.
proactive mindset and dive deep into applications, services, and people to create a resilient landscape for their applications.
strong problem-solving skills, effective communication skills, experience in incident management, change management, and crisis management.
Knowledge of mobile app development
experience with Scrum and/or DevOps

job_description:
Wat verwachten wij van jou als Business Analist?
Als Business Analist ben je verantwoordelijk voor het verzamelen, controleren en analyseren van financiële gegevens. Hierdoor ondersteun je niet alleen de Finance Manager, maar fungeer je ook als centrale kennishub voor commerciële en financiële data. Je levert relevante ondersteuning aan projecten en neemt initiatieven om interne systemen, procedures en processen te optimaliseren.
Binnen deze rol is het jouw taak om periodieke financiële rapportages te analyseren en tijdig aan te leveren voor het management. Je bent betrokken bij het opstellen van het strategisch plan, budget en forecast en draagt bij aan de jaarafsluiting en de jaarlijkse audit. Daarnaast communiceer en verbind je met verschillende interne en externe stakeholders en signaleer je belangrijke trends in financiële wet- en regelgeving. Naast het coördineren van de controle op het debiteurensaldo en het uitvoeren van kredietwaardigheidstoetsen, lever je ook relevante ondersteuning aan verschillende projecten binnen Boon Edam Nederland B.V. en bedrijfsoverschrijdende projecten.
Ben je een gedreven en analytische professional en op zoek naar een leuke startersfunctie? Solliciteer dan nu en word de nieuwe Business Analist bij Boon Edam Nederland B.V.
Wat breng je daarvoor mee?
Wij zijn op zoek naar een topper op wie de volgende kreten van toepassing zijn:
Afgeronde HBO opleiding;
Excellente kennis van PowerBI en Excel;
Proactief en integer;
Communicatief, grammaticaal en cijfermatig sterk;
Ervaring met SAP is een pré.
Vergrote afbeelding weergeven
Vergrote afbeelding weergeven
Vergrote afbeelding weergeven
+1
Meer afbeeldingen openen
Wat krijg je ervoor terug?
Een leuke startersfunctie met professionele, superleuke en gezellige collega’s (vooral die twee laatste eigenschappen mochten niet ontbreken volgens jouw toekomstige collega’s);
Een goede work life balance door 27 vakantiedagen, 13 atv-dagen, flexibele werktijden en de mogelijkheid om thuis te werken;
Een dienstverband voor 32-40 uur per week;
Volop ontwikkelmogelijkheden, waaronder het volgen van diverse cursussen via onze Boon Edam University;
Werken in een dynamische en veranderende omgeving van een groeiende ‘mini’- multinational met de sfeer van een familiebedrijf;
Salarisindicatie: €3.250 - €4.500 afhankelijk van kennis en ervaring.
Wil je meer weten over deze functie?
Neem dan contact op met Susan Starren, Finance Manager, via 06-12504864.
Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze advertentie wordt niet op prijs gesteld.
Wil je solliciteren?
Ben je in je carrière aan een nieuwe uitdaging toe? Reageer dan door je CV inclusief motivatie te sturen naar: werken@boonedam.nl t.a.v. Jessica Bond, o.v.v. ‘Business Analist’.

Waar kom je te werken?
Koninklijke Boon Edam is wereldmarktleider op het gebied van entreeoplossingen. We zijn een succesvolle en groeiende ‘mini-multinational’ met fabrieken, verkooporganisaties en exclusieve partners in alle delen van de wereld. Met zo’n 1300 medewerkers draaien we een uitstekende omzet.
Boon Edam Nederland is een succesvolle organisatie die zich bezig houdt met de verkoop, installatie, service, onderhoud en upgrades van onze entreeoplossingen binnen Nederland. Wij zijn een groep van ruim 110 professionals die alles in het werk stellen om onze relaties optimaal van dienst te zijn. Daarbij hebben wij belangrijke onderwerpen als energiebesparing en zorg voor het milieu hoog in het vaandel staan. Alles wat wij doen is gerelateerd aan gedrevenheid, respect en toewijding, de kernwaarden van onze organisatie. Wij onderscheiden ons door onze specifieke bedrijfscultuur die zich laat kenmerken door waardevol werk, openheid, eerlijkheid en waardering.
KOM JIJ ONS PRACHTIGE BEDRIJF VERSTERKEN?
Andere vacatures bij Boon Edam
Op zoek naar een uitdagende carrière in een technologische branche? Koninklijke Boon Edam is wellicht de toegang tot je toekomst.
Bekijk onze vacatures
pros:

2. There are always surprises but only the pleasant ones, such as free grocery cards, picnics and luncheons, non-promised bonus, etc
3. Very friendly and social peers and management, no politics, no "boss-ism".
4. If you start failing to perform your job properly, they work with you to fill-in the gaps. You will loose your job only if you mess-up big and repeatedly, otherwise they don't leave any card un-turned to help you improve.', 'More emphasis on safety and outlook towards future', 'The company offers a chance to work for an international company (the company is Dutch owned and has customers throughout North America) while still working in a small-ish company. 

Management is very accessible as is most of the staff. Management caters quarterly lunchs for staff.', 'Interesting products, international company, good people;  You get to do a variety of jobs if you would like.  You work hard but the management seems to be fair.', 'They have a good benefits package. I am a single male and paid nothing for my basic medical each month. There is an annual bonus that is pretty generous until it is taxed.', 'Excellent coworkers, perks, and benefits']

This goes for all positions not just Fabrication Techs.", 'Pay was a little below average, Opportunities to advance were minimal']

job_description:
Dit wordt je functie
We zijn een internationaal team dat samenwerkt met investeringsafdelingen op de financiële markt. Wij bieden strategische oplossingen op basis van de laatste technologieën om nieuwe investeringsstrategieën te ondersteunen en zo de grootst mogelijke rendementen voor onze klanten mogelijk te maken.
Als je wil bijdragen aan het ontwerp en bouw van de volgende generatie zakelijke applicaties met de modernste tech, goed bent in het iteratief verfijnen van gebruikerseisen en onduidelijkheden kunt wegnemen, en nieuwsgierig van aard bent en altijd geïnteresseerd in manieren om te innoveren, ben je bij ons aan het juiste adres.
We zijn op zoek naar een ervaren, professionele bedrijfsanalist voor het volgende:
Ondersteuning en uitvoering van activiteiten van de eigenaar van het product / bedrijfsanalyses door coördinatie en aansturing van IT-implementaties, inclusief gebruikersacceptatietests.
Processen, producten en diensten in kaart brengen, analyseren en evalueren.
Het in kaart brengen van vereisten uit een verscheidenheid aan interne en externe data en gesprekken met eindgebruikers.
Het verstrekken van documentatie voor processen en bedrijfseisen.
Ondersteuning van business-architecten door het beschrijven van de zakelijke processen, inclusief de organisatorische structuren.
Ondersteunende project-managementtaken en - diensten.
Uitvoering van data- en systeemanalyses op grote schaal.
Het ontwikkelen van inzicht in gegevens, passende datamodellen kiezen en robuuste ETL/ELT pijplijnen ontwerpen samen met onze data engineers en ontwikkelaars.
Inzichten in complexe vereisten, hoogwaardige oplossingen om aan de vraag binnen de kapitaalmarkt te voldoen en volledig onderzoek van de afhankelijkheden en implicaties van de verandering voor verschillende onderdelen.
Het uitvoeren van de productvisie en -afspraken in een Agile-omgeving.
Samenwerken met zakelijke belanghebbenden, functieoverschrijdende teams, support teams en de organisatie om obstakels weg te nemen.
Optreden als verbindingspersoon tussen de teamleden, IT, investeringsdesks en betrokken blijven bij strategische architectuur en ontwerp.
Beheren en 'eigen' maken van belangrijke delen van het project, vanaf de eerste vraag tot het testen van de oplossing en de aflevering voor productie.
Dit breng je mee
Je bent een ‘T-shaped professional’. Dat wil zeggen dat je diepgaande specialistische kennis hebt en ook een generalist bent, bijvoorbeeld op het gebied van communicatie en samenwerking. We vinden het verder belangrijk dat je gedreven bent, autonoom handelt en verantwoordelijkheid neemt. Je bent integer en durft fouten te maken; daar leer je van en zo ontwikkel je jezelf. En verder heb je:
Minimaal 5 jaar ervaring als Business Analist of Data Analist
Diploma in bedrijfskunde, financiën, economie of gelijkwaardig
Eerdere ervaring met Scrum/Agile-methodologieën met applicatie-ontwikkelingsprojecten op ondernemingsniveau
Sterk analytisch, probleemoplossend en synthetiserend vermogen
Het vermogen om een reeks technische vereisten te interpreteren en robuuste oplossingen te ontwikkelen
Ervaring met bedrijfsanalyse of projectmanagement in de financiële sector, idealiter met een achtergrond in de vermogensbeheersector
Sterke communicatie vaardigheden, met het vermogen om effectief te communiceren met zakelijke en IT-stakeholders
Flexibele en veerkrachtige teamspeler met sterke interpersoonlijke vaardigheden die initiatief neemt om dingen vooruit te helpen
Aanpasbaar, in staat om in verschillende teams en functies in een multinationale omgeving te werken
Alle kwalificaties zoals CFA zijn een extra pluspunt
Hier ga je aan de slag
We bieden je een bruto salaris van € 4.700 - € 6.500 (40 uur) en mooie arbeidsvoorwaarden gericht op flexibiliteit, zoals:
Een gegarandeerde eindejaarsuitkering van 8,33%.
Veel aandacht voor jouw vitaliteit en persoonlijke ontwikkeling.
Hybride werken: thuis én in één van onze prachtige kantoren.
En uiteraard een goed geregeld pensioen.
Voor pensioenuitvoerder APG gaat pensioen over mensen, leven en samenleven. Met zorgvuldig vermogensbeheer, pensioenadministratie, communicatie en advies wil APG meehelpen aan een leefbare toekomst waarin we welvaart en welzijn eerlijk en duurzaam samen delen. Voor huidige en toekomstige generaties. Voor nu, straks, en later.
APG zet zich in voor 4,7 miljoen mensen in Nederland. Daarom vinden wij het belangrijk om ook een afspiegeling te zijn van de Nederlandse maatschappij. Dat betekent dat APG streeft naar een inclusieve werkomgeving, waarin iedereen zichzelf kan zijn én waarin iemands unieke kwaliteiten omarmd worden.
Als je kiest voor APG, kies je voor een baan waarin je bijdraagt aan een mooie toekomst. Solliciteer dus nu!
pros: ["The best reason, they will treat you very well. All my employers have been very helpful and supportive the entire time I've been here. The pay is decent and the bonuses at the end of the year are good. But it all comes down to how well you're treated at your work place, and I have been treated very well here.", 'Flexibility, pay is decent, it has benefits']

job_description:
Salesforce Business Analyst
Take your next career step at ABB with a global team that is energizing the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future. At ABB, we have the clear goal of driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions: gender, LGBTQ+, abilities, ethnicity and generations. Together, we are embarking on a journey where each and every one of us, individually and collectively, welcomes and celebrates individual differences. ABB E-mobility is a world leader in EV charging technology with a strong R&D pipeline and an unparalleled global reach. With our robust product portfolio of innovative holistic solutions – from grid to charge point and domestic installations to large fleet depots – we are actively enabling the future of e-mobility, not just predicting it. The exciting developments within this sector perfectly align with our Mission to Zero initiative, aiming to support cleaner and greener communities for all.
As Salesforce Business Analyst, you will be responsible for bridging the gap between the technical environment (Salesforce) and the business (Service) by gathering requirements and using data analytics to assess processes, outline problems, opportunities, and solutions, to support decisions and engage IS for technical change management. You will be part of the Digital Service Tooling Team in Delft, which has a focus on developing a high standard of service on the various charging systems. We make sure all our products can be serviced, maintained, configured and diagnosed in the right way by the right service engineers. This means we are the interface between development and operations in the field, from drawing board to End of Life. This requires a strong knowledge of different aspects of our systems and as a team we make sure we cover all of the aspects. One of the key aspects to service chargers is our connected digital environment.
Your responsibilities
Applying related business processes knowledge, shapes and aligns IS solution/services in Salesforce to build and deliver activities.
Identifies and propose prioritization of functional requirements with the Product Owner
Functionally defines solutions together with the respective Process Owners fulfilling customer requirements leveraging best practices.
Serve as primary system administrator for the Salesforce environment with 500+ users
Handle user maintenance, small modifications of page layouts, reporting and dashboarding, creation of simple fields and other routine tasks - in alignment with product owner and IS application owner.
Gather detailed requests for improvements or changes to the system, and implement these changes as appropriate.
Train new users and grow the Salesforce skill set across the organization
Automate simple processes using Salesforce tools such as process builder, flow automation, validation rules.
Identify, install and maintain appropriate apps from the AppExchange for event management, mass email, document merge, and more
Engages with business leaders, consumers, and customers to understand how changes to process, products, services, software, and hardware can improve efficiencies and add value, while balancing these ideas with what’s feasible technologically and financially, and functionally reasonable.
Your background
You have a Bachelor or Master degree in a technical field, for example Information Technology, Electrical Engineering, or demonstrable equivalent knowledge.
You are an IT specialist with a wide range of interest in protocols, security, sustainability, smart grid control, programming, scripting.
Knowledge of Salesforce, Linux-based operating systems, cloud systems, cyber security.
(Basic) programming skills in various (scripting) languages.
You are able to work independent and proactive.
You are solution-oriented.
Clear and direct communicator, tactical when needed.
You are eager to learn and you are prepared to develop technical skills within this area.
You have good communication skills towards both external and internal parties.
You like working in a multidisciplinary team and you have excellent knowledge of the English language both speaking and in writing.
Preferably also knowledge of Dutch and one or more other languages.
More about us
We look forward to receiving your application (documents submitted in English are appreciated). If you want to discover more about ABB, take another look at our website www.abb.com. If you want to discover more about ABB, take another look at our website https://e-mobility.abb.com/ Our offer: We offer you a varying and responsible job in an international concern which feels very strongly about the development of its staff. You will have the freedom to assume a whole variety of responsibilities within a quickly evolving environment. You can also count on a competitive compensation package in line with your capabilities and experience. Are you interested in joining ABB E-mobility? We look forward to receiving your application online via the ‘apply now’ button below. For further questions, contact Tessa van den Hoek, Talent Partner, via Tessa.van-den-hoek@nl.abb.com
pros: ['Innovation and quality... global reach.', 'The people and the possibility of the company hiring leadership that make the culture what it use to be', 'Work is exciting, colleagues would have been enough to keep me there.', 'Treats employees with respect. Cares about work like balance. Managers are empathetic. Managers lead by example.']
cons: ['Lots of structure and protocols.', 'Constant change/reorganization Leadership has drastically changed over the years, new leadership does not care about its most valuable resources, the employees Corporate vision and employee surveys are rolled out but no action taken to follow the results No work/life balance small yearly increases that do not cover the cost of inflation Benefits have been taken away over time', 'Top heavy, poor communication, poor onboarding, poor implementation of new processes.', 'Company does not compensate at the high end of the salary range.']

job_description:
The Role
Where you fit in
Trading & Supply Products (TSP) is at the heart of Shell’s Downstream business. TSP has the primary responsibility of managing and optimizing the physical product supply chain, as well as creating value through advanced trading strategies. Our goal is to create value for the Shell’s bottom line, and deliver on our promise to decarbonize our portfolio amongst others using Nature Based Solutions.
The Business Analyst is part of a team which provides critical solutions and insight that drive integrated value generation within North-West Europe. The team acts as a center of excellence and combines talent development, knowledge building and organizational & supply chain optimization competences.
The role is also responsible for running small to large (agile) improvement projects which take many forms: developing (IT-) tools, changing business processes or ways of working , with the aim of supporting TSP along its digital transformation journey. As an active member of the Exposure Management & Supply Analytics team (working close together with trading), you will oversee and contribute to the price risk management (PRM) process using a proprietary ETRM systems called DEX.
The Business Analyst is responsible for the upkeep, management and ownership of a large trading & supply portfolio supporting key business decision makers with analytic insights into exposure and profit & loss drivers. He or she ensures that the quality of the inputs is sound and that the right processes are followed to guarantee an accurate outcome in DEX. The applicant will support Root Cause Analyses to help solve process-or-system problems in close collaboration with a wide variety of stakeholders across the Supply Chain. The chosen candidate will be exposed to price risk exposure management and Profit & Loss (P&L) in relation to market pricing and trading instruments.
The candidate will be part of a young(-minded), multi-cultural and diverse team which holds office in the heart of Rotterdam. Regular social team events make for a tight-knit group of enthusiastic people working together towards the same goal. A recent move to a swanky new office space offers a wide variety of perks (not all included in contract) such as: a wide variety of healthy lunch options, a gym, a parcel pick-up point, a high quality (coffee) bar and with quick access to the Central Station making commuting a treat. However, the working environment also offers opportunities for flexible ways of working like partly working from home.
What’s the role?
As a Business Analyst, you are expected to:
Be in close collaboration with Derivatives and Oil Traders, Channel Optimizers, Deal Makers, Deal Implementors and Commercial Oil Operators on connecting physical supply chain movements to exposure & profitability changes.
Align daily with the Traders / Channel Optimizers about the hedge position and be able to explain the drivers of the exposure and P&L changes (together with the Market risk-team as 2nd line of defense).
Track and support the resolution of input/process inconsistencies.
Managing DEX ETRM tool, Partake in monthly mass balance & profit & loss reconciliations.
Ensure all tools and interfaces are working, Be the custodian of master data record upkeep.
Review natural length hedged positions as well as maintain cost accruals and volume forecasts for term deals and deals with a past date pricing term.
Natural Length, non-oil costs and accruals in DEX (transport costs, CSO, etc.)
Be able to work with big data analytics tools and having experience with any of Spotfire, Alteryx, Power BI, Excel, Python.
Drive improvement projects looking at tools/process within own accountabilities as well as being involved/lead wider regional (European) supply chain improvement projects impacting the bottom line / support Shell’s journey in the Energy Transition .
What we need from you
We are hoping to find the following in your CV:
Masters in Supply Chain Management, Data Science, Engineering, Business (Operational Analytics), or Finance Control.
Experience in Hedging, Derivatives, Price Risk Management and Finance Reporting.
Experience with programming (SQL, Python, Power BI, Power Query or Alteryx) and must be confident to work with large amount of data.
Keen to understand Supply and Trading processes and willing to learn how to connect their environments.
Analytical, systems/process and accounting skills, with the ability to recognize underlying issues and develop appropriate resolutions.
Experience in Supply Chain or Finance industries advantageous.
Having knowledge on a subset of these 8 areas is preferred:
Ability to manage day-to –day exposure activities.
Primary distribution and operations.
Managing Relationships / Stakeholders and influencing skills.
Contract Performance Management.
Supply Chain Integration & Optimization.
Demonstrated ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines.
Continuous Improvement mindset, have a learner mindset to drive projects, innovative solutions that drive end to end value across business lines.
Company Description
Shell Nederland BV is a platform for international collaboration, offering direct employment to around ten thousand people in the Netherlands alone, including roughly 2,800 non-Dutch employees from around 80 countries. Diversity is key at Shell Nederland, and our employees reflect the innovation that stems from a diverse workforce. Shell Nederland is the holding company of most Shell companies operating in the Netherlands. Shell Nederland also has an advisory and coordinating role in numerous areas.
An innovative place to work
There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell!
Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.
An inclusive place to work
To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.
We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.
We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.
We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.
We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.
A rewarding place to work
Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.
We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.

Disclaimer
Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. This policy describes the processing that may be associated with your personal data and informs you that your personal data may be transferred to Shell/Shell Group companies around the world. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
pros: ['Been there 6 months, has never been a better job for a young person.', "Pay is competitive for energy majors, being a European company they are a little more relaxed and better work life balance than what I've heard from others at US based energy majors. A big focus on safety and trying their best to do the right thing.", 'Smart people. Interesting work. Excellent compensation.', 'Processes and procedures are first class. Pay is great.', "Good Pay. Lot's of training amd education. Very interesting work.", 'Great place to work and grow as an individual with focus on people. DE&I is one of the core focuses of Shell culture on how it treats its employees.', 'All was good I love people so good fit for me', 'work schedule, pay and benefits, quality of life, safety culture']
cons: ['Nothing is wrong with the company', 'So much corporate politics and bureaucracy. Hard to get things done. Seems like there has been a "re-org" and layoffs every 2-3 years since 2015. Many high flying managers get shuffled around quickly and by the time they get to upper management, they haven\'t ever really stayed in any part of the business long enough to see all the cost cutting measures they took start to backfire. Continuous shift towards treating our projects and engineering/staff as a simple generic commodity that can be outsourced to shorter term contract workers, and HVEC (High Value Engineering Center) aka low cost places. IT and HR was completely gutted and outsourced, it\'s a nightmare now trying to get help from those support functions.', "Big corporate atmosphere hard to take sometimes. Endless turnover at mid-mgmt level with lots of churn at the asset level as new managers on their way up the ladder stop on your department's rung, make lots of changes, and climb on.", 'Big company so there is bureaucracy and red tape. Most people are good to work with/for but with so many employees you will come across bad ones.', 'I wanted to move from New Orleans to Houston, and a team in Houston said they wanted me on their team. The New Orleans team blocked the move. If you want to advance your career or want a change, do it externally to Shell, don\'t let Shell hold you back. Poor work life balance, lots of after hours calls and a typical week is already 60 hours. Company continues to make this worse by laying people off. People are frequently promoted into roles they are not qualified for. This is frustrating when you have to teach senior people how to do their job, but also stressfill when it happens to you . Management of Change process is very cumbersome. Very poor software is used. Shell was very cowardly about oil and gas outlook in 2020. When oil was cheap and we should have been spending big money on maintenance and refurbishment, they focused on laying off employees. By the time "project reshape" was executed, gas was back to $80 per barrel.', 'Not any significant ones besides any role or situation dependent ones.', 'They could do better with scheduling and making sure people show up on time for their shifts', 'accountability, senior level mentoring/sponsorship, work environment,']

job_description:
This role will responsible for working on meaningful projects as a Business Analyst.
For Rabobank Utrecht, we are looking for a Business Analyst:
Rabobank is a cooperative bank with over 8,5 million customers. Through large and small initiatives, the bank aims to make the world a little bit better. They support local enterprises and larger non-profit organizations and thus contribute to the welfare and prosperity of the community.
As a Business Analyst at Tribe Business Intelligence & Analytics (BI&A) you will support the internal reporting activities within CFO. You will co-create, support and maintain applications that deliver automated dashboarding and reporting. These dashboards are designed to drive the fact based decision making in the bank and facilitate the steering of the performance.
You and your job
You make a contribution by being the SQL expert for complex reporting challenges that you tackle in an Agile environment. Together with Developers, Analysts and the Product Owner you transform the business requirements into dashboards.
Fine working relationshipin the Area standard management reporting for Group and RGOtogether with 10 direct colleagues in your squad36 hours per week
You and your talent
An excellent command of the Dutch and English language, spoken and written;
You are a top player in working with data and data analysis using SQL;
At least 10 years experience in BI and Data;
Focused on solutions;
Able to contribute to our value: We bring out the best in each other and keep learning – I make you better;
Strive to improve every day;
Strive for results.
Position number: 224581
Our Core values at Coach4expats
️ Transparency: We believe in transparent and smooth recruitment processes. You will get feedback from us.
️ Candidate experience: Perfect blend between automated and humanized recruitment processes. Don't hesitate to ask us for feedback, anytime.
️ Talented pool: We bring highly-skilled motivated candidates to our clients. Our candidates match their company values and management style.
️ Diversity and inclusion: There is no place for discrimination and intolerance. We care about diversity awareness and respect for any differences.
pros:
['Good salary hike and great company culture', "These folks know exactly what they are doing. They set high standards, and consistently deliver. 
Their project expectations and planning is excellent. The top level management folks are extremely smart and have a great sense of vision and planning. If you go to company social events (which are very frequent by the way), it is quite easy to have conversations with upper management people (Partners). 

Deloitte's hiring pattern is very consistent. For the young starters, they hire smart, well spoken, and subtly aggressive candidates. They have excellent training and knowledge management. They have a well oiled and empowered HR and Tech Support group. Things get done pretty fast. 

Their paid time off program is really great, and pretty straight forward. No messing about.

They have a big social responsibility program that encourages volunteering. It also presents a great opportunity for youngsters to take event organizing responsibilities. This can be very very useful. Once, I volunteered for an event where we painted rooms for an orphanage center. There was a young guy who did the organizing. We were 10-12 people, with 3 senior executives actually doing paintwork. Quite unique. 


I have personally seen that Deloitte's top talents tend to start young, spend a 3-4 years, then take a hiatus to pursue a Graduate Degree (typically an MBA). The firm sometimes re-hires these consultants after their MBA with generous financial incentives. They offer much better packages to folks graduating from top universities. Sometimes they can offer huge joining bonuses. 

I worked in the IT consulting division.They tend to get top-end projects. On projects, the average age seems pretty low.  A lot of 20-somethings, then there are a handful of 30-40 year old people and some senior Management folks.

Beginner salaries can be a bit low. (which is expected. It takes some time to build credibility in the Consulting business)

Overall, a great place to start your professional career. If you pay attention, you will get seasoned very quickly.", "They pay you well and give you at least a week and a half as a collective disconnect in Dec. for the entire US and global firms. WFH Surrounded by highly talented, ambitious people at all levels. They push you outside of your comfort zone so you grow and learn more than you every thought possible. Awesome talent and learning department and curriculum. Offices are stunning with lounge floors, coffee shops, gym and a beautiful atmosphere to work on your own, collaboratively or host guests. They have high expectations of you but that also increases your confidence after multiple successes. They build leaders and you will walk away feeling like you are the best version of yourself in the professional arena. Autonomy, freedom to make independent decisions. You don't realize how much you appreciate it until you go somewhere else that doesn't trust their employees.", 'Vast opportunities for people with true talent who are collaborative and can navigate the culture. Favors people with mature networking skills and the ability to seek out mentors.', 'I have been with Deloitte for a little over a year and a half now and I absolutely love it. I have provided just a few points below as to why I enjoy working at Deloitte: - Well-rounded, intelligent, and hard-working colleagues that want to see you excel in your position and career - Clear career path - Extensive growth and networking opportunities - Ability to work with incredible clients from all industries - Amazing benefits and perks (well-being subsidy, etc.) - 401K matching I also want to add that although Deloitte is a very large company, it has never felt that big to me. Everyone that I work with and have worked with in the past has been extremely communicative and responsive.', 'I learned a lot at my time at Deloitte. The PTO is very generous and you are encouraged to use it. My superiors were all very knowledgeable and hardworking, and they try to foster a supportive culture. However public accounting is a tough space to work in and there’s only so much the firm can do, the work is a lot and needs to get done. Soul sucking during busy season but worth it if you can stick it out to senior.', 'The overall compensation and rewards are good (nothing extraordinary though... Medical, Dental and Vision, 401k, performance bonus, etc), pay ranges are competitive yet not the best in class.', "Deloitte provides a very thorough onboarding which made me feel ready to tackle my job. I've also rececived a $500 stipend to set up my office, a $250 stipend to purchase my company phone and accessories, and an $1,000 wellness subsidy.", 'If you love to not be at home, this is the place for you.']
cons:
['I really don’t see any company con. All grievances would be person/position specific', 'Work-life balance can become poor, especially during tight project timelines (This is expected in the Consulting Business). The employees have a significant amount of "firm-internal" training and knowledge contribution tasks. There are annual goal expectations. It can get tedious if you continuously work on high demand projects.

There is intense competition, especially during targeted promotion/milestone years. There can be some backstabbing. It's part of the experience. It is not as bad as it sounds, and seems manageable. 

A lot of times, being young and inexperienced has it's flaws. The company has a simple way of seasoning consultants. They get pushed into high pressure situations, and they learn fast, and quickly start managing their own work. But they tend to be blind towards intricate details, especially in complicated IT product implementations. This has an interesting effect. If someone is able to do the hands-on work, everyone else tries to piggy-back on that person for their actual work. The hands-on guy gets overwhelmed, and others try to use him/her as a key resource. 
-- I personally went through a crunch project, and found a number of people "managing expectations" (piggy backing), while a handful of people actually knew the end-to-end solution and did the hands-on work. 
This created a lot more work and mental anguish than needed. Because of the expressed pressure, the hands-on guys have a hard time building and growing their reputation and subsequent performance evaluation rating. This also affects the project execution timelines.

IMPORTANT: Make sure you thoroughly read through your employment agreement and understand the implications. In recent years, they have started hiring for specific projects ONLY. This falls under a particular "AMS service line". In this case, if your assigned project gets into a problem, you are exposed to the risk of employment termination. 
Their HR and Management are very helpful, and they will try to get you a new project. But there are several constraints like location, your skills, and limited time. I went through this, and it was somewhat unnerving. This was one of the reasons I ended up leaving the company.', "People can take advantage of delegation I was on one project that demanded I worked 65 hours a week for months and burnout is no joke. Bonus isn't great until you reach Sr. Mgr. Death by power point. The number of decks I had to produce and revise over the years added little value and no cost savings to anyone. They also caused so much unnecessary stress because some leaders valued optics over output. You'll see a lot of people getting ahead just by playing the game and building their eminence as they like to say. Performance isn't enough. You need a strong image and exposure. Networking is entrenched into the culture and anyone who is more on the introverted side might feel pressure to be someone they're not.", 'Work life imbalance is improving, but still a moving target', "I can't think of many cons to working at Deloitte. I am in Consulting, so I think the only thing that can be tough is when you are on the bench waiting for another staffing opportunity after finishing up a client project. I'm not the most patient person, so sometimes it can be hard waiting to get that staffing confirmation for a new project.", 'Besides the bad hours, the pay was low as well. But great resume builder for a CPA.', "The work culture is unhealthy. It's usual to find employees forced to chose pressing work deliveries or extenuating work schedules over their familiy and personal priorities. Long-tenured employees are used to it and have somehow survived, however they justify it for the sake of building career opportunities within the organization. The organizational structure and leadership model is very unclear and confusing. Usually you don't have one manager to report to. Although you may be part of one team, you report to different managers for different things, which leads to losing the sense of belonging and identity. It also makes unclear the escalation paths. Job titles are usually overstated and don't necessarily reflect the actual hierarchy and authority. It is very usual to find Managers, Senior Managers, and even Directors and Managing Directors, without direct reports and without teams and departments to manage. Job titles are usually given as a form of recognition that doesn't represent the actual position in the organization. Overall, it is not a good place to work for professionals and leaders with experience in other companies, since the culture and customs are very different, even toxic and unhealthy for some. It may be a good fit for very young people without a referent to other business cultures.", 'The biggest drawback is the expectation that we work around partner schedules to get pursuits out, which means we might be working after hours or over the weekend', 'For the most part, the PPMDs are the kings & queens and everyone else is there to help them with their "optics". Not saying they are bad humans (payers), just that the system (game) is set up to promote looking good over doing good. Bonuses are made out to be objective but in reality, are subjective. Two people could have the same metrics but receive very different bonuses.']
